intro: Sutera linifolia, commonly known as the white mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cotton and hibiscus. Sutera linifolia typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential healing properties.
